adviseScripts.text: It's very gloomy in the hospital these days. It feels like everyone is down in the dumps.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I feel depressed as well. I can't shake the feeling.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: What can I do to change the atmosphere?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: You should dance to cheer them up.
Change your gloomy hospital lights for brighter ones.
A cheer-up dance?!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: H-how does that dance go?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Uh... No, I won't learn it. I will never dance.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: The lights?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Huh, come to think of it, it looks like the lighting has become dimmer.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I'll change it immediately!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I help Pepper out with the atmosphere at the hospital.
People at the hospital say I've never dated anyone before.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Do you think that's true?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: No, of course not.
You've dated before?
Really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: You're telling the truth, right? That I don't come off that way?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Haha. Thank you, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: All right, it's true! I haven't!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: But I don't want to look like I haven't.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Commander, you are so mean!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Pepper about dating.
Commander, where do you like to take your dates?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: The movie theatre.
The library.
Huh? Really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Me, too! I always want to go to the movie theater.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: So... I guess... It's not really a date, but would you like to go with me next time?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I didn't know you were so academic!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I... prefer watching movies...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: But the library is nice, too!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I spend a nice time with Pepper, planning where to go for fun.
It seems that the number of patients faking illnesses has been increasing lately.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Why do you think that is?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Maybe it's because they want to see you, Pepper.
So they could see Mary.
Me? Why?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I've never done anything that could get me on anyone's bad side...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Mary?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Mmm... I guess that's possible.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Occasionally, some patients intentionally come to get a stinging shot from Mary...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Pepper about patients with fake sicknesses.
Commander, I admire Mary a lot.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I want to become the best doctor, just like her.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: So, what do you think I should study?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: How to cure a patient's fake illness?
How to kill someone with a smile?
Mary is known to be kind to patients and scary to fake patients.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: If I study hard, I think I will be able to become a sharp doctor like her!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Does she have a scary smile?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I never noticed that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Pepper about Mary.
I've been thinking about this real hard. When you feel sick,
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I think it's best to get diagnosed and treated fast as possible.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: So, why do people hate coming to the hospital?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Because getting a shot is scary.
Because Mary is scary.
I see! Getting a shot is quite scary...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: A lot of people are afraid of needles.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Because of Mary?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: No way. She is so nice to everyone! Except for fake patients...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: ... or annyoying patients...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Pepper about how to bring more people to the hospital.
Terrorists! Criminals!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I hope they suffer!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I hope they suffer more than everyone they've hurt!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Calm down.
... I agree.
Sorry. I just get so worked up.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: There were patients who came to the hospital because of a terrorist attack...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I can't help but feel so angry about it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Commander, do you also think the same way?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I didn't expect you'd be agreeing with me. I thought you were going to tell me to calm down...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I got so angry because some new patients came to the hospital after a terrorist attack...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I feel better knowing you're on my side.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Thank you, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I console an angry Pepper.
I heard tomorrow's weather will be very nice.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: What should we do?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Clean the hospital.
Let's go on a date.
Uh... Right. If the weather is nice, we should stay inside and clean.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I was expecting something else, like... a date, maybe?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: ... I guess I was a little immature.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Right! A date!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: But, I have no one to go with...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Commander, would you... like to go out with me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I spend time with Pepper, talking about tomorrow's plans.
Commander, please tell me your definition of a real doctor!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Someone with the skill to heal all kinds of patients.
Someone who works for the patient.
You're right. Skills are very important!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: If you don't have the skill, the patients are not going to believe that you can save them.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Haha. To be honest, I feel the same way.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Even though the skill to save the patient's life is important,
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I feel a doctor who focuses on serving the patient
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: is always greater.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I have a serious conversation with Pepper about doctors.
Between having something refreshing and something sweet,
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: which one do you think can give you more energy?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Something refreshing.
Something sweet.
I feel the same way!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: When I eat something refreshing, I feel like energy is flowing back to my body.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Like my blood is getting filled up with vitamins.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: As if nothing can stop me!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: It's decided: the children's snack at the hospital will be lemon-flavored Splendamin!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Uh... Is that so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Hmmm... I thought you were going to choose something refreshing.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Hmmm. Come to think of it, when you're tired, it means you're low on sugar.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I guess eating something sweet really can give you some energy.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I discuss energy-giving foods with Pepper.
Commander, it's been a while since you last came to the hospital.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I take it that means you're feeling well?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Fit as a fiddle.
Actually, I'm not feeling too hot.
That's a relief.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Your health is the number one priority.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Even if you're feeling perfectly fine, drop by every once in a while for a checkup.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: What?!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Where aren't you feeling well?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Why haven't you come to the hospital?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Tell me about your symptoms. I want all the details.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I talk to Pepper about my health.
According to Signal,
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: a lot of TV shows about doctor-patient relationships are trending right now.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: What do you make of that?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I find it all very romantic.
Doctors should treat their patients as just that: a patient.
It's incredibly romantic!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I hope one day I can experience a love like that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: With that being said, I always keep my relationships with my patients strictly professional!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: You're right...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: In actuality, we should never breach the trust between us and our patients like that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I guess at the end of the day, TV shows really are just works of fiction.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Pepper and I have fun dissecting the intricacies of various medical field-related romantic fantasies.
Mary's smile always puts the people around her at ease.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Hehe.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: If I smile like this, do I look like her?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Your eyes should be more moon-shaped.
Your smile also comforts those around you.
R-really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: But my eyes are all the way closed at this point!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: So Pepper is practically blind whenever she's smiling.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: R-really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Hehe... thank you, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: So... how do you feel right now?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Pepper and I continue our conversation with permanent grins on our faces.
Administering a shot to younger patients is a real challenge.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Is there any way to make it easier?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: You should use anesthesia.
Give them some candy, like a lollipop.
You mustn't use anesthesia so recklessly!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: You could end up causing serious injury to someone.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I guess all I can do is do my best to comfort them to get them through it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Good idea!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: After they get their shot, I'll give them a little treat.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: That way they won't be as terrified about getting a shot.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Pepper and I discuss the widely held fear of shots.
In private rooms, we can personalize the music that we play for the patient.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: If you were in a private room, what kind of music would you like to hear?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Something quiet and calming.
Something light and hopeful.
Just as I thought.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Most of the patients prefer calmer music as well.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I'm sure it helps put their minds at ease.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: As for me, I personally enjoy music with a lighter touch.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I'm surprised to hear you say that, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Most people prefer calmer music,
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: but there are a few patients who go the other way.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: They say lighter music energizes them.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Personally, I agree with them!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Pepper and I talk about the different genres of music that are played in hospital rooms.
Um, Commander... I was curious about something.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: What do you look for in a significant other?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Someone who is bright and energetic.
Someone who is kind and loves to laugh.
I see...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: That means I have a chance!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Or... maybe not? Is it possible? Yes? No? Ugh...!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I see...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Don't tell me it's Mary?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: If it is Mary, she is certainly the ideal type for a lot of people.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: It's certainly possible.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I calm down the overexcited Pepper.
Commander, do you prefer movies with a happy or sad ending?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Sad ending.
Happy ending.
I didn't realize there were people who preferred sad endings!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I suppose they do leave a deeper impression. Is it because of that?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Hmm... I'm not sure I agree.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I prefer when everybody can laugh and get along, whether it's in a movie or in real life.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Yeah, nothing beats a feel-good ending!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I love it when everybody can laugh and get along, whether it's in a movie or in real life.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: It makes you feel all warm and fuzzy inside.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Pepper and I talk about movies.
I'm thinking of buying some perfume.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Commander... what kind of scent do you prefer?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: That great hospital smell.
You smell good even without perfume.
Are you serious?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: There's no perfume that smells like that!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: You're just making fun of me since it's my first time buying perfume!
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Wait, you really think that...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Hehe. Thank you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Pepper and I talk about our favorite scents.
Commander...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Will there ever come a time when there are no injured or sick?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Um...
I'm sure that day will come eventually.
Oh, sorry for putting you on the spot.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I know it may just be a pipe dream, but...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I've had a lot of patients pass away full of regrets. I guess it all got to me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Thank you for listening to me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I know it may just be a pipe dream, but...
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I've had a lot of patients pass away full of regrets. I guess it all got to me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: But hearing you say that makes me feel like even the most outlandish pipe dream is possible.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Thank you, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I patted Pepper on her shoulder.
Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: When you look at me, what's the first phrase that pops into your head?
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: A doctor who makes people happy.
A highly-skilled medical professional.
Wow... I'm really touched.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: My dream is to be a doctor that makes people happy.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I still have a long way to go, but I'll do my best to live up to that idea.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Thank you, Commander.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I have a long way to go before I can be called a medical professional.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: Sigh... I'm sorry. I'm happy to hear you say that, but I wouldn't say I fit that description just yet.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: But thank you anyway for saying that.
adviseScripts.speaker: Pepper

adviseScripts.text: I continue showering Pepper with compliments.
